pivotable 0.0.0.9002

Set a default to display totals for an R session

Source: R/pivot-default.R
pivot_default_totals.Rd

Set a default to display totals for an R session

pivot_default_totals(include_column_totals = TRUE,
  include_row_totals = TRUE)

Arguments

include_column_totals

Indicates if the column totals are included in the pivot table
include_row_totals

Indicates if the row totals are included in the pivot table

Examples


pivot_default_totals(TRUE, TRUE)

retail_orders %>%
  pivot_rows(status, country) %>%
  pivot_values(n())
#>                          n()  
#> Cancelled   Spain          1  
#>             Sweden         1  
#>             UK             1  
#>             USA            1  
#>             Total          4  
#> Disputed    Australia      1  
#>             Denmark        1  
#>             Spain          1  
#>             Total          3  
#> In Process  Australia      1  
#>             Belgium        1  
#>             France         1  
#>             Spain          1  
#>             USA            2  
#>             Total          6  
#> On Hold     Sweden         1  
#>             USA            3  
#>             Total          4  
#> Resolved    Austria        1  
#>             Denmark        1  
#>             Spain          1  
#>             USA            1  
#>             Total          4  
#> Shipped     Australia     17  
#>             Austria        6  
#>             Belgium        6  
#>             Canada         7
